rationale: This species is known from the Sekong, Mekong and Mun Rivers. It is severly affected by the impact of dams, with the Thai population already almost extirpated due to the construction of the Pak Mun Dam. With the construction of the Sekong 4 and Sekong 5 dams due, a projected population decline over the next ten years is conservatively  given as 30-50% and the species is assessed as Vulnerable, however if the construction of Ban Koum goes ahead the  decline could be even greater.
evaluator: Vidthayanon, C., Rainboth, W. & Brooks, E.
